newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Res up after taking stake in bank.
newsitem.headline: China Res up after taking stake in bank.

text.p: Shares of China Resources Enterprises Ltd rose after the company announced a plan to buy a stake in Hongkong Chinese Bank Ltd and a stake in a concrete maker from its parent, brokers said on Thursday.

"Anticipation that the company may further acquire assets from its parent, to enhance itself as one of the major Chinese conglomerates in Hong Kong, fueled investors interest in the stock," said Anthony Mak, a sales director at Vicker Ballas.
China Resources shares rose HK$2.60 or 9.38 percent to HK$30.30 in late morning, after they resumed trading following a one-day suspension.
China Resources said it was buying a 50 percent stake in the Hongkong Chinese Bank and an 80 percent stake in a concrete manufacturer Redland Holdings Ltd.
